document.masterDocTitle: New synonyms, combinations and status in the Chinese species of the family Meloidae Gyllenhal, 1810 (Coleoptera: Tenebrionoidea) with additional faunistic records

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New synonyms, combinations and status in the Chinese species of the family Meloidae Gyllenhal, 1810 (Coleoptera: Tenebrionoidea) with additional faunistic records

mods:name.mods:affiliation: The Key Laboratory of Zoological Systematics and Application, College of Life Sciences, Institute of Life Science and Green Development, Hebei University, Baoding, Hebei 071002, P. R. China

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Meloe sibirica Pallas, 1773: 720
.
Type locality: “ Sibiria ” ( Russia )
. Type depository: destroyed by fire.

Meloe pectinata Goeze, 1777: 701
.
Type locality: “ Sibiria ” ( Russia )
.
Type depository: unknown. Synonymized by
Schoenherr 1817: 26
.

Lytta dubia Fabricius, 1781: 329
.
Type locality: “ Sibiria ” ( Russia )
.
Type depository: ZMUC. Synonymized by
Liu et al. 2016: 361
.

Lytta chinensis Laporte, 1840: 274
.
Type locality: “Chine” ( China )
.
Type depository: MNHN. Synonymized by
Liu et al. 2016: 361
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Lytta badeni Haag-Rutenburg, 1880: 77
.
Type locality: “Ind. or., China ”
.
Type depository: ZSM , HNHM . syn. nov
.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Epicauta taipina Kôno, 1936a: 90
.
Type locality: “ Taipin , Formosa ” (= Taipei , Taiwan , China )
.
Type depository: EIHU. Synonymized by
Kaszab 1952a: 580
.

Epicauta badeni sinica
Kaszab, 1960: 256
. Type locality: “Mengtze” (= Mengzi City , Hani-Yi Autonomous Prefecture of Honghe ), Yunnan , China . Type depository: IZCAS, HNHM. syn. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph:

Lytta badeni
:

Lytta Badeni Haag-Rutenberg
” ( HNHM ; Fig. 16 )
.

Epicauta badeni sinica
:
Paratype : 1♂ , “ ñRŤRẋd [ China , ES Yunnan , Mengzi ]
1350 m
//
1956.VI.2
// Ɩ ṪÁK [ Panfilov ]”, “Ю. В. Юньнань . Мынцаы // 1350 м.
2.VI.1956
// Панфилов”, “ Paratypus // 1959 ♂ //
Epicauta Badeni sinica Kaszab
” ( HNHM ; Fig. 17 )
.

Distribution. China : Anhui , Beijing , Gansu , Guangdong , Guizhou (new record), Hainan , Hebei , Heilongjiang , Henan , Inner Mongolia , Jiangsu , Jiangxi (new record), Jilin , Liaoning , Ningxia , Qinghai , Shaanxi , Shandong , Shanxi , Sichuan , Taiwan , Xinjiang, Xizang, Yunnan, Zhejiang; Japan , Kazakhstan , Korea , Mongolia , Russia .

Remarks. The four species,
Epicauta badeni
,
E. chinensis
,
E. dubia
, and
E. sibirica
, are morphologically similar except the coloration of the head, the shape of male antennae, and the gray setae on the elytra ( Kaszab 1952a ; Tan 1958 ).
Liu et al . (2016)
discussed the variation of the above three features and proposed that
E. chinensis
and
E. dubia
are junior synonyms of
E. sibirica
. Recently, one of us (Z. Pan) examined one paratype of
E. badeni
HaagRutenburg, 1880, and one paratype of
E. badeni sinica Kaszab, 1952
at HNHM, and considered both as junior synonyms of
E. sibirica
.
